common.welcome: Welcome to San Juan Tahitic Cooperative

hero.discoverAria: Discover more about tourism in San Juan Tahitic
hero.adventureAria: Start your adventure in San Juan Tahitic

highlights.natureText: Mountain landscapes, rivers, and waterfalls that invite adventure and relaxation. Explore unique trails and connect with the region’s biodiversity through unforgettable experiences.
highlights.gastronomyText: Local delights that blend tradition and authentic flavor in every dish. Discover ancestral tastes in local markets and restaurants offering innovative traditional cuisine.
highlights.communityText: Warm and welcoming people who make you feel at home. Join community activities and learn life stories that enrich your cultural experience.
highlights.traditionsText: Festivals, dances, and crafts that preserve the region’s cultural richness. Experience unique celebrations and learn artisanal techniques passed down through generations.

footer.description: A destination that combines natural beauty, cultural richness and human warmth. Explore everything our community has to offer you.
footer.rights: © 2025 San Juan Tahitic. All rights reserved.

culture.description: Our rich cultural heritage is the soul of San Juan Tahitic. Discover the traditions, art and expressions that have shaped our community identity throughout the centuries.

calendar.subtitle: Don’t just read about our culture — live it, feel it, and take it with you.

carousel.title: Discover the essence of
phrases: Feel the magic of the mountains and the echo of their traditions.
Every dance tells a story... every step holds emotion.
Where nature embraces culture and the soul feels free.
The heart of the Sierra beats in San Juan Tahitic.
Your next experience begins here, where time stands still.

culturesection.dancesDescription: Cultural expressions that share the history, spirituality, and identity of San Juan Tahitic through movement and rhythm.
culturesection.craftsDescription: Unique creations made by local artisans using techniques passed down from generation to generation.
culturesection.languageDescription: Learn about the Náhuatl language — its origins, current use, and common expressions in San Juan Tahitic.
culturesection.gastronomyDescription: Explore the traditional flavors of San Juan Tahitic: local ingredients, typical dishes, and artisanal cooking.
culturesection.preservationDescription: We actively work to preserve and promote our cultural heritage. Through workshops, festivals, and educational programs, we keep alive the traditions that define us as a community.

language.description: Explore the beauty and sonority of our mother tongue through everyday phrases that have been passed down through generations in our beautiful

call.subtitle: Where every dish tells a story and every flavor creates an unforgettable memory
call.inspirationalQuote: More than a dish, a meeting with the true essence of San Juan Tahitic

community.description: We are a family united by the land, the stories of our ancestors, and a deep sense of mutual support. Discover the hands and hearts that make San Juan Tahitic a truly unique place.

timeline.description: A journey through time to discover the moments, places, and people that shaped our identity.

present.description: Discover how we live today: a community that honors its heritage while actively building its future with hope and unity.
present.numbersDescription: Data that reflect the vitality and progress of San Juan Tahitic
present.source: Source: Community Council of San Juan Tahitic
present.wouldYouLikeToVisit: Would you like to visit us?
present.visitDescription: Experience firsthand the warmth and cultural richness of San Juan Tahitic. We invite you to be part of our community, even if just for a day.

pillars.title: Collective Work (Tequio)
pillars.description: Community labor is the foundation of our unity. An ancestral system of mutual aid to build and sustain the well-being of all.

pillars.title: Gastronomy and Agriculture
pillars.description: From the field to the table. Our crops of corn, beans, and coffee form the heart of a cuisine that nourishes both body and tradition.

pillars.title: Festivals and Traditions
pillars.description: The festive calendar is our cultural heart. Dances, music, and faith intertwine in celebrations that reaffirm our identity year-round.

pillars.title: Education and Future
pillars.description: We invest in new generations. Our schools are seedbeds of talent, preparing young people for the future without forgetting their roots.

attractions.description: A glimpse at the projects that are transforming San Juan Tahitic and that you’ll soon be able to enjoy.

project.title: Tourist Cabins (Phase I)
project.subtitle: Lodging for the Future of Tourism in Tahitic
project.description: A community project designed to offer a unique immersive experience. Eco-friendly, comfortable cabins built with traditional methods and local materials — boosting both the economy and ecotourism.

constructionImages.title: Cabin Foundations
constructionImages.description: Working on the foundations with sustainable methods

tequio.title: Tequio: Collective Work
tequio.subtitle: The ancestral tradition that strengthens our community of San Juan Tahitic
tequio.heroDescription: Tequio is the heart of our social organization in San Juan Tahitic. For generations, this collective labor has allowed us to build schools, maintain roads, protect springs, and strengthen the bonds that define us as a community.
tequio.projectsDescription: Works built together for the well-being of the entire community
tequio.benefitsDescription: The values and benefits we gain through collective labor
tequio.testimonialsDescription: What our neighbors say about the Tequio experience
tequio.heritageDescription: In San Juan Tahitic, Tequio remains the cornerstone of our community organization, showing that collective work is the foundation of sustainable development and the preservation of our ancestral traditions for future generations.

carousel.roadsDescription: Community united in maintaining rural roads
carousel.reforestationDescription: Planting native trees to preserve our resources
carousel.springDescription: Caring for our traditional water sources
carousel.celebrationDescription: Sharing and living together after collective work

projects.name: Rural Road Maintenance
projects.description: Repairing and cleaning the roads that connect our communities and fields, ensuring safe access for all families.

projects.name: Community Reforestation
projects.description: Planting native trees in degraded areas to preserve our natural resources and maintain ecological balance.

projects.name: School Maintenance
projects.description: Repairing and improving educational infrastructure to provide dignified learning spaces for our children.

projects.name: Spring Cleaning
projects.description: Preserving our water sources through cleaning and maintenance, honoring ancestral wisdom.

benefits.title: Community Unity
benefits.description: Strengthens the bonds between families and generations, creating solid networks of mutual support

benefits.title: Sustainable Development
benefits.description: Projects that benefit the entire community in the long term while caring for the environment

benefits.title: Cultural Preservation
benefits.description: We keep ancestral traditions of collective work and mutual aid alive

benefits.title: Self-Management
benefits.description: We solve our own needs with our resources, without depending on external aid

testimonials.name: Doña Rosa Martínez
testimonials.testimonial: Tequio unites us like a family. My children and grandchildren learn the value of collective work. It’s the most precious legacy we inherited from our elders.

testimonials.name: Juan Pérez
testimonials.testimonial: Each Tequio strengthens our community. We see tangible results and grow together as a people. Unity gives us strength.

testimonials.name: María González
testimonials.testimonial: We, the youth, find in Tequio a way to contribute and keep our traditions alive. It’s our grain of sand for San Juan Tahitic.

gastronomymodal.title: Gastronomy:
gastronomymodal.subtitle: ancestral flavors
gastronomymodal.description: From the field to the table: preserving our food sovereignty and traditional flavors in San Juan Tahitic.
gastronomymodal.heroDescription: In San Juan Tahitic, the land gives us more than food — it gives us identity. Our milpa agriculture and traditional cuisine are the living legacy of generations who lived in harmony with nature.
gastronomymodal.productsDescription: Grown with sustainable methods that respect the earth’s cycles and preserve biodiversity.
gastronomymodal.flavorsDescription: Recipes passed down through generations, preserving our culinary identity.
gastronomymodal.knowledgeDescription: Traditional wisdom sustaining our relationship with the earth and our food.
gastronomymodal.heritageDescription: In San Juan Tahitic, every dish tells a story and every flavor keeps memory alive — a living testament to the harmony between people and land.
gastronomymodal.heritageTag: San Juan Tahitic - Flavors that endure

carousel.cornDescription: Our ancestral maize, the base of community food.
carousel.marketDescription: Fresh products from local family gardens.
carousel.coffeeDescription: Grown on the mountain slopes with care.
carousel.tamalesDescription: Flavors passed from generation to generation.

products.name: Native Corn
products.description: Ancestral maize varieties grown through the milpa system, rich in flavor and nutrition.

products.name: Black Beans
products.description: Grown on the mountain slopes, known for their creamy texture and deep flavor.

products.name: Highland Coffee
products.description: Organic coffee grown at 1,200 m, with chocolatey notes and intense aroma, processed by traditional methods.

products.name: Medicinal Herbs
products.description: Ancestral wisdom in herbs like chamomile, arnica, and mint, cultivated in family gardens.

dishes.name: Mole de Caderas
dishes.description: Ceremonial dish made with goat, chiles, and ancestral chocolate, a culinary heritage of the region.

dishes.name: Bean Tamales
dishes.description: Corn-leaf tamales filled with black beans and regional herbs, essential in family celebrations.

dishes.name: White Corn Atole
dishes.description: Warm beverage made with white corn, cinnamon, and piloncillo — traditional comfort during cold days.

knowledge.title: Milpa System
knowledge.description: Intercropping of maize, beans, and squash that enriches the soil and ensures food diversity.

knowledge.title: Nixtamalization
knowledge.description: Ancestral process of cooking corn with lime to enhance nutrition and flavor.

knowledge.title: Natural Preservation
knowledge.description: Sun-drying and storage techniques to preserve grains all year round.

knowledge.title: Herbal Medicine
knowledge.description: Traditional use of plants for family and community health.

festivities.title: Festivities and Traditions
festivities.subtitle: The cultural heart of San Juan Tahitic beats to the rhythm of our ancestral celebrations
festivities.identityDescription: Every festivity in San Juan Tahitic is a living fabric of history, faith, and community. Our traditions are not only preserved — they are lived with the same passion as centuries ago, creating memories that transcend generations.
festivities.calendarDescription: Events that mark the rhythm of our community life throughout the year
festivities.danceDescription: Movement that tells our story and preserves our collective memory
festivities.heritageDescription: Knowledge and expressions that define our identity as a community
festivities.finalDescription: In San Juan Tahitic, every celebration is a living chapter of our shared history. The traditions we preserve today are the legacy we pass on to future generations, keeping alive the flame of our cultural identity.
festivities.whereTraditionLives: San Juan Tahitic – Where Tradition Lives

carousel.patronalFestival: Patron Saint Festival of San Juan
carousel.patronalDescription: Celebration in honor of our patron saint with processions and traditional dances
carousel.moorsDescription: A colorful historical representation that preserves our cultural memory
carousel.dayOfTheDeadDescription: Altars and offerings that honor our ancestors
carousel.carnivalDescription: Masks, music, and joy fill the community celebration
carousel.holyWeekDescription: Religious traditions that unite the community

festivals.name: Patron Saint Festival of San Juan
festivals.description: A celebration in honor of our patron saint with masses, processions, and community festivities lasting three days. The entire town gathers to honor the traditions passed down from our ancestors.

festivals.name: Day of the Dead
festivals.description: We honor our ancestors with family altars, offerings, and candlelight vigils at the community cemetery. A tradition that reflects our deep connection to the cycle of life and death.

festivals.name: Traditional Carnival
festivals.description: A pre-Lenten celebration filled with parades, handcrafted masks, and traditional dances that bring color and joy to the town’s streets.

festivals.name: Holy Week
festivals.description: Live representations of the Passion of Christ and ancestral religious traditions that bring the community together in faith and reflection.

dances.name: Dance of the Moors
dances.description: A historical dance depicting the battles between Moors and Christians, featuring colorful hand-embroidered costumes and traditional wind music.

dances.name: Son de la Malinche
dances.description: A ceremonial dance narrating cultural encounters through elegant movements; recognized as an element of intangible cultural heritage.

dances.name: Los Chinelos
dances.description: A joyful dance characterized by energetic jumps and large-mustached masks, symbolizing celebration and festive social satire.

heritage.title: Traditional Wind Music
heritage.description: Community bands preserving ancestral musical repertoire for festivities.

heritage.title: Festive Handicrafts
heritage.description: Crafting of masks, costumes, and decorations using techniques passed down through generations.

heritage.title: Ceremonial Gastronomy
heritage.description: Preparation of special dishes for each festivity based on ancestral recipes.

heritage.title: Orality and Storytelling
heritage.description: Transmission of stories, legends, and knowledge through oral tradition.

education.investmentDescription: We invest in new generations to build a promising future without losing our roots
education.educationDescription: In San Juan Tahitic, education is the driving force behind our community development. We integrate ancestral knowledge with educational innovation, shaping critical, creative citizens committed to collective well-being.
education.educationPillarsDescription: The foundations that guide our community educational project
education.educationalPathDescription: A continuous learning journey from early childhood to higher education
education.collectiveAchievementsDescription: Recognitions that reflect the teamwork of our entire educational community
education.finalMessage: In San Juan Tahitic, every classroom is a space of hope, every lesson a bridge to the future, and every student a seed of change for our community and the world.
education.learningCreatesFutures: San Juan Tahitic - Where learning creates futures

carousel.learningCommunityDesc: Students developing projects that benefit the entire community
carousel.educationalFacilitiesDesc: Spaces designed for integral learning and human development
carousel.practicalActivitiesDesc: Education that combines theory and practice in real-world settings
carousel.academicCelebrationsDesc: Recognition of our students’ efforts and achievements
carousel.educationalTechnologyDesc: Integrating modern tools with traditional methods

institutionss.name: "María Montessori" Kindergarten
institutionss.description: Early education focused on integral development and community values, where children learn through guided play and exploration.
institutionss.motto: Learning through play, growing through dreams

institutionss.name: "Benito Juárez" Elementary School
institutionss.description: Basic education that combines the official curriculum with community knowledge, fostering critical thinking and cultural identity.

institutionss.name: "Nezahualcóyotl" Telesecundaria
institutionss.description: Secondary education with an emphasis on technology and community projects, preparing youth for the challenges of the modern world.

institutionss.name: Community High School
institutionss.description: Upper secondary education with technical specializations and social engagement, training leaders committed to their community.

pillars.title: Academic Excellence
pillars.description: Constant pursuit of knowledge and high-level competency development

pillars.title: Cultural Identity
pillars.description: Strengthening our heritage and community values in every student

pillars.title: Technological Innovation
pillars.description: Integration of digital tools with advanced pedagogical methods

pillars.title: Sustainability
pillars.description: Environmental education and sustainable practices as a cross-cutting axis

achievements.description: National recognition for our comprehensive community educational model
Partnerships established with national and international universities
Transformation of educational spaces with renewable energy and bioclimatic design

cooperative.description: The CHIWANJMEJ Cooperative Society and Café Yektanesik strengthen the local economy through artisanal, sustainable products with deep cultural identity. Every purchase directly supports the families of San Juan Tahitic.

coffee.title: Café Yektanesik
coffee.description: High-altitude organic coffee, cultivated and produced by local families with tradition and passion.

punch.title: Punche & Chiwanjmej Liquors
punch.description: Ancestral Punche drink and handmade liquors with traditional flavors, crafted within the community.

soaps.title: Artisanal Soaps
soaps.description: Made with local medicinal plants under the 'Sembrando Vida' (Sowing Life) program.

juices.title: Yektanesik Juices
juices.description: Fresh fruit juices from the region, 100% natural and nutritious.

impact.impactDescription: Each product or service from the cooperative represents fair income, preserves traditions, and strengthens the social fabric of San Juan Tahitic.

cooperative.cta: Discover the Cooperative of San Juan Tahitic

services.collectionDescription: Discover the treasures born from collective work and love for our land
services.noProductsDescription: Try other search terms or adjust your filters

cooperativesection.description: Discover the authentic richness of San Juan Tahitic. Products grown with love, ancestral techniques, and the commitment of a community united for the common good.
cooperativesection.solidarityDescription: Each purchase supports the sustainable development of our community and preserves centuries-old traditions.

testimonials.testimonio: My hands don’t just weave threads; they weave dreams and stories...
This land is not a resource; she is our mother...
testimonials.tagline: Keeper of the land and its crops

testimonials.testimonio: We carry the pride of our past, but our steps move toward the future. Our dream is to build a bridge for the world to know our culture.
Every note of our music tells the story of our mountains and rivers. We don’t just play instruments — we keep alive the voice of our ancestors through the melodies they left us.
In my kitchen, flavors are love letters to our land. Each dish tells a story of sowing, harvesting, and the hands that make this daily miracle possible.
Tequio reminds us that we are stronger together. When we work shoulder to shoulder, we don’t just build roads or schools — we weave the trust that makes us a true community.
Teaching here is not just sharing knowledge — it’s helping children find balance between the pride of their roots and the opportunities of the modern world.

header.title: Voices of our land
header.description: The voice of each inhabitant holds a piece of our identity. Listen, feel, and connect with those who keep the culture of San Juan Tahitic alive.

closing.title: The Voice of Our People
closing.subtitle: Each story is a bridge between past and present. By sharing their voices, our communities strengthen their identity.
closing.description: San Juan Tahitic is not just a place… it is a living story told by its people.

contact.title: Contact & Information
contact.subtitle: Plan your visit to San Juan Tahitic. We are here to help you organize a memorable experience in our destination.
contact.mapDescription: San Juan Tahitic is located in an area with easy road access. From the regional capital, the journey takes approximately 2 hours by private vehicle or public transport.

tourism.mainDescription: San Juan Tahitic offers unique experiences for nature lovers and adventure tourism. Discover landscapes that will connect you with the essence of our land.
tourism.mountainTrailsDescription: Explore trekking routes with spectacular panoramic views and unique landscapes that connect you with nature.
tourism.naturalReserveDescription: Discover local biodiversity in our preserved forests and unique ecosystems full of life.
tourism.riversWaterfallsDescription: Enjoy crystal-clear waters and natural waterfalls perfect for ecotourism and relaxation.
tourism.panoramicViewpointsDescription: Capture the best views from our strategically located viewpoints for unique moments.
tourism.sustainabilityDescription: Our commitment to responsible tourism ensures the preservation of our natural resources for future generations. Every visit contributes to local economic development and environmental conservation.

tourismsection.description: Discover the stories, legends, and moments that have given life to San Juan Tahitic. Each corner holds a tale that, through tradition and memory, has woven the cultural soul of our people through the centuries.
